static.title: Last Upload/Download
static.popup_info: tada!

static.title: Files to upload
static.popup_info: Number of data files ready for upload to Motus that have not previously been uploaded.

static.title: DOWNLOAD
static.popup_info: Download all data files to your computer that have not previously been uploaded or downloaded.

static.title: Upload
static.popup_info: Upload all new files to Motus.org now, requires internet connectivity

static.title: Internet
static.popup_info:
Internet connectivity check: checks whether a widely used connectivity check URL is reachable, specifically, http://connectivitycheck.gstatic.com/generate_204 used by most Android devices.
Connectivity is checked periodically and when the network configuration changes.

static.text:
# Upgrading the SensorGnome software

To upgrade the SensorGnome software:

- Enable the buttons
- Use `check` to get a list of upgradable packages, wait for the list to show in the "available upgrades" panel.
- Use `sg upgrade` to upgrade the Sensorgnome software without upgrading the rest of the operating system.
- Wait for the upgrade log panel to show "_END_".
- Reload the browser and check that the "current version" panel reflects the upgrade (you can also re-run the "check").
- In general, a reboot is recommended at this point.

To upgrade the full operating system and Sensorgnome software:

- Upgrading the operating system _is not recommended as a routine practice_!
- Ensure you have physical access to your Sensorgnome and the ability to insert a freshly flashed SD card in case the upgrade fails and you have to start from scratch.
- Perform the same steps as above, but use `sysupgrade` instead of `sg upgrade`.

static.title: Restart
static.popup_info: Restart the main data acquisition and upload processprocess

static.title: Power OFF
static.popup_info: Shut down the Sensorgnome operating system and power off

static.title: Internet via
static.popup_info:
Interface through which packets to internet hosts are routed.
Eth=ethernet, wlan0=wifi, wwan0=cellular

static.title: Detections (daily)
static.popup_info: Each data point represents a day, the total chart 100 days. For CTT, tag detections are shown, for Lotek, radio pulses are shown. (It takes 4 pulses for a tag detection.) Each data point shows the sum of detections during the subsequent 24 hours.

static.title: Lotek Tag Detections
static.popup_info: Display Lotek tag detections for tags that are in the local tag database.

static.title: repeat
static.popup_info: Repeat the last download in case it was misplaced or some error occurred.

static.title: All
static.popup_info: Download all files to your computer/phone regardless of prior uploads/downloads.
The Wifi client can be used at the same time as a hotspot and/or ethernet.

The HotSpot can be used at the same time as Wifi and Internet. There is no password, but the only reachable service is this dashboard via HTTPS and a password.
Notes: When enabling HotSpot the WiFi may drop for a few seconds.
The HotSpot disables itself after 30 minutes (regardless of network activity).
If the status keeps cycling between associating and disconnected/inactive then most likely the password is incorrect. Unfortunately there is no good error message for this common failure case...

static.title: Motus.org
static.popup_info:
Connectivity to motus.org: checks whether HTTP requests complete, specifically to https://www.motus.org/data, which is used to upload data files.
Connectivity is checked periodically and when the network configuration changes.

static.title: Lotek tag detection log
static.popup_info:
The detection log shows raw detections coming from the radios. Its primary purpose is to verify correct operation of the radios. For CTT tags the format is as follows:

TAG: T6,1665900910.226,78664C33,-95

The T6 refers to CTT radio on port 6, 1665900910.226 is the timestamp (seconds since 1970-1-1) 78664C33 is the CTT tag ID and -95 is the RSSI (dBm).

For Lotek tag first the raw radio pulses are shown as follows:

PLS: p5,1665900923.5965,3.96,-48.31,-60.86
PLS: p5,1665900923.6185,3.948,-48.76,-60.92
PLS: p5,1665900923.6380,3.986,-47.99,-60.94
PLS: p5,1665900923.6625,3.989,-47.62,-61.01

PLS stands for pulse, p5 refers to "pulse on port 5", this is followed by the time-stamp, the frequency offset in kHz from the nominal frequency, the RSSI (dBm) and the noise (dBm). It takes 2 bursts of 4 pulses to detect a tag if the tag is found in the local tag database. A tag detection is hown as follows:

TAG: L5,1665900923.5965,TestTags#1.1@166.38:25.1,3.971,0.02,-48.1,11.1,-60.9,3223,95,1.97e-07,-4.96e-05,166.38

The L5 refers to a Lotek tag detected by the radio on port 5. This is followed by the tag name and ID, the nominal frequency, the pulse interval (25.1s in this case), the freq offset in kHz, and further details about the pulse burst.

static.title: TagNames
static.popup_info:
Direction finding is an experimental feature to help track or locate a tag using a hand-held Sensorgnome. The functionality is very simple: up to two tags can be entered and then detections are only shown for those two tags with the RSSI of the detection.

A '*' in the tag1 field enables the display of all received tags. For Lotek tags that are in the local database, provide the numeric ID, such as '1.2'. For CTT tags provide the hex ID, such as 78336498.

static.title: check
static.popup_info:
Check the operating system repositories for packages to upgrade.
Requires internet connectivity.
Does not perform any changes.

static.title: sg upgrade
static.popup_info:
Upgrade the Sensorgnome packages shown in the "available" widget.
This may upgrade some system packages because they are dependencies.

static.title: Help
static.text:
This page allows data files to be uploaded to Motus.org or to be downloaded to your computer. When there is Internet connectivity files are uploaded automatically when the next file is started (typ. hourly). The upload button is for situations where you manually establish internet connectivity and need to kick off uploading immediately.

The red `download` button downloads all files to your computer/phone
that have not been uploaded or downloaded yet.
The `all` button downloads all files irrespective of prior uploads/downloads (this could be big),
this can be useful as a backup.
The `repeat` button repeats the last download in case it was misplaced or some error occurred.

Login: in order to upload files the Sensorgnome needs to authenticate with the Motus upload server. The mechanism for this is still in flux. By default, the Sensorgnome obtains credentials from a sensorgnome.net server, but it is also possible to enter Motus.org login credentials explicitly. These credentials are not stored/saved on the Sensorgnome: they are briefly used to obtain an authentication token which is stored. The Sensorgnome must have connectivity at least every 45 days to refresh this token or it expires (in which case a new login may be required).

static.title: Port Mapping Help
static.text:
- all radios (Lotek & CTT) must show up in the "port mapping" widget
- all radios must have a distinct port number from 0 to 9
- the detection log should show any test tags in the vicinity

### Built-in port numbering

- rPi 4B: port 1: lower outside, 2: upper outside, 3: lower next to ethernet; 4: above 3; plug hub into the latter
- rPi 3B & 3B+: port 1: upper next to ethernet, 2: below 1, 3: upper outside, 4: lower outside; plug hub into the latter

### Port Mapping info

When a device is plugged into USB its port is represented by a path, such as 1.2.3.
The Sensorgnome must report tag/pulse detections to Motus using a "port number" in the range 0..9
(0 really being 10) and the port numbers configured here must correspond to the port/antenna numbers in the "receiver deployment" on the Motus site.

The Sensorgnome image is pre-configured to support up to 4 radios plugged into the rPi ports, or 3 radios directly plugged in a 4 more on a 4-port hub, or 3 + 7 using a 7-port hub. The pre-configured port mapping makes assumptions that may not match the specific hub you may be using, for this reason you may want to alter the mapping.

The port mapping allows explicit port mappings to be enforced, such that ports on the rPi and
on a hub can be labeled 1..10 in a reasonable order.
The mapping simply assigns a port number to a path using a notation like
`path -> port`, for example, `1.2.3 -> 3` to map path `1.2.3` to port `3`.
To alter the port mapping use the pencil edit button on the port mapping widget.

On a __rPi 4B__ the built-in USB ports have paths 1.1 through 1.4 (1.1 is on the bottom closest
to the Ethernet, 1.4 is at the top outside corner). The default mapping assigns port 1 to path 1.3 (lower outside), port 2 to path 1.4 (top outside), port 3 to path 1.1, and port 4 to path 1.2 (top next to ethernet).
This may be a bit confusing, the reason is so a hub can be plugged into the top blue USB3 port.
This results in ports 4 through 10 being on the hub.

On a __rPi 3B__ the built-in USB ports have paths 1.2 through 1.5 (1.2 is on the top closest
to the Ethernet, 1.5 is at the bottom outside corner). A 4-port hub plugged into the bottom outside
port will result in paths 1.5.1 through 1.5.4.

In terms of ordering of mappings: the first line with a matching path wins!

static.title: sysupgrade
static.popup_info:
Upgrade all packages listed in the "available" widget, including Sensorgnome and system packages.
This is not recommended unless you have a way to recover, i.e., swap out a freshly flashed SDcard.
After the upgrade, a reboot is generally recommended.

Label: the label is shown at the top-left of the dashboard and is used in the filenames of all data files produced.

Memo: a memo field for your use, for example to remember peculiarities about the set-up.

static.title: Help
static.text:
This tab provides overview info, please use the other tabs (tab bar at the top or hamburger menu on mobile devices) to view and edit data files, wifi&network settings, software updates, etc.

Getting started:
- Plug in ethernet or configure WiFi in the network tab.
- Configure radios in the radio tab and ensure all radios have a correct port mapping.
- Check that data files are uploading in the files tab.

static.label: A Motus login is usually not needed.

static.title: Reboot
static.popup_info: Reboot the Sensorgnome operating system

static.title: State
static.popup_info:
Modem states:

- disabled: SG software has not enabled the modem yet
- enabled: modem is trying to register ("connect with") cellular network, this may take time and never change if the SIM does not provide service
- registering: transient state attempting to register with cellular network
- registered: connected to the cellular network but no internet access (incorrect APN?)
- connected: connected to the cellular network and internet access according to the modem

static.title: Network Usage
static.popup_info: Network usage information collected every 5 minutes and aggregated over time. Uses "vnstat".

static.title: Release train
static.popup_info: Sensorgnomes should use the 'stable' release train to ensure reliable operation. For testing purposes, e.g. when trying out new features in the field, this toggle allows the Sensorgnome to be switched to the 'testing' release train. The testing release train always has packages equal or newer than stable. After switching release train, please run a software upgrade CHECK followed by an SG-UPGRADE (if desired). The toggle by itself does not change any software, it only toggles which packages are considered by CHECK and SG-UPGRADE..

static.title: Remote commands
static.popup_info: Allow commands from SG hub to reboot the system, restart the control process, and start/stop Hot-Spot. Commands can be initiated by any user having access to the Motus project and Motus admins.

static.title: Remote Web UI
static.popup_info: Allow remote web UI access via SG hub. Requires the Sensorgnome's password like local access.

static.title: Lotek radio pulses
static.popup_info:
The detection log shows raw detections coming from the radios. Its primary purpose is to verify correct operation of the radios. For CTT tags the format is as follows:

TAG: T6,1665900910.226,78664C33,-95

The T6 refers to CTT radio on port 6, 1665900910.226 is the timestamp (seconds since 1970-1-1) 78664C33 is the CTT tag ID and -95 is the RSSI (dBm).

For Lotek tag first the raw radio pulses are shown as follows:

PLS: p5,1665900923.5965,3.96,-48.31,-60.86
PLS: p5,1665900923.6185,3.948,-48.76,-60.92
PLS: p5,1665900923.6380,3.986,-47.99,-60.94
PLS: p5,1665900923.6625,3.989,-47.62,-61.01

PLS stands for pulse, p5 refers to "pulse on port 5", this is followed by the time-stamp, the frequency offset in kHz from the nominal frequency, the RSSI (dBm) and the noise (dBm). It takes 2 bursts of 4 pulses to detect a tag if the tag is found in the local tag database. A tag detection is hown as follows:

TAG: L5,1665900923.5965,TestTags#1.1@166.38:25.1,3.971,0.02,-48.1,11.1,-60.9,3223,95,1.97e-07,-4.96e-05,166.38

The L5 refers to a Lotek tag detected by the radio on port 5. This is followed by the tag name and ID, the nominal frequency, the pulse interval (25.1s in this case), the freq offset in kHz, and further details about the pulse burst.

static.title: Lotek Pulses
static.popup_info: Display pulses received by the FCD or RTL-SDR radios. It takes a burst of 4 pulses to make a tag detection, and in addition two bursts are required so the inter-burst interval can be measured. The two bursts must be consecutive or have a one burst gap.

static.title: Lotek Background Noise
static.popup_info: Background noise level reported by the radios when a pulse is received. The background noise is only measured/reported when a pulse arrives so a test tag in the vicinity is pretty much required (unless there are tagged birds around). The noise floor measurement when a random 'noise' pulse is received is likely not to be accurate.

static.title: Tags and Pulses
static.popup_info:
# Detection log

The detection log shows raw detections coming from the radios. Its primary purpose is to verify correct operation of the radios. For CTT tags the format is as follows:

TAG: T6,1665900910.226,78664C33,-95

The T6 refers to CTT radio on port 6, 1665900910.226 is the timestamp (seconds since 1970-1-1) 78664C33 is the CTT tag ID and -95 is the RSSI (dBm).

For Lotek tag first the raw radio pulses are shown as follows:

PLS: p5,1665900923.5965,3.96,-48.31,-60.86

PLS stands for pulse, p5 refers to "pulse on port 5", this is followed by the time-stamp, the frequency offset in kHz from the nominal frequency, the RSSI (dBm) and the noise (dBm). It takes 2 bursts of 4 pulses to detect a tag if the tag is found in the local tag database. A tag detection is shown as follows:

TAG: L5,1665900923.5965,TestTags#1.1@166.38:25.1,3.971,0.02,-48.1,11.1,-60.9,3223,95,1.97e-07,-4.96e-05,166.38

The L5 refers to a Lotek tag detected by the radio on port 5. This is followed by the tag name and ID, the nominal frequency, the pulse interval (25.1s in this case), the freq offset in kHz, and further details about the pulse burst.

static.title: Lotek Sample Rate
static.popup_info: Rate at which the pulse finder is receiving samples from the radio (SDR). This must be 48kHz (within rounding error) for the pulse detection to function correctly. If it is lower than 48kHz is indicates that USB packets are lost and this will affect pulse detection.

static.title: Alter bootCount
static.popup_info: Change the boot count to avoid overlap when re-initializing a Sensorgnome using a fresh SDcard

static.title: errors
static.popup_info: null

static.title: Lotek SNR
static.popup_info: Signal-to-noise ratio reported for Lotek pulses. The detection of pulses requires that they stick out at least 6dB above the noise floor.

static.title: RTL-SDR AGC
static.popup_info:
Enable automatic gain control. Can only be used with RTL-SDR and should only be enabled if a permanent test tag is in the vicinity of the station as the AGC relies on periodic pulses from a test tag. AGC adjusts the gain once a minute when a pulse is detected to place the noise level between -35dB and -45dB.
This is an experimental feature that should generally be OFF.

static.title: RTL-SDR gains
static.popup_info: RF gain configured into the receiver of each port. The initial gain is set in the acquisitions.json file. For RTL-SDRs it is possible to enable AGC (automatic gain control).

static.title: Show pulses
static.popup_info: Toggle the display of detected Lotek pulses in the tags and pulses panel on/off. Tags are always shown.
